title: fatal error: unexpected signal during runtime execution when starting peer to peer node
body:
#### System information

Geth
Version: 1.9.13-stable
Architecture: amd64
Protocol Versions: [65 64 63]
Go Version: go1.14.2
Operating System: darwin
GOPATH=
GOROOT=/usr/local/Cellar/go/1.14.2_1/libexec
#### Expected behaviour

Geth should output "Starting peer-to-peer node" after outputting "Maximum peer count"

#### Actual behaviour

Output "fatal error: unexpected signal during runtime execution" and crash down

#### Steps to reproduce the behaviour

I only execute "geth"

#### Backtrace

````
INFO [05-06|16:44:05.841] Starting Geth on Ethereum mainnet...
INFO [05-06|16:44:05.841] Bumping default cache on mainnet         provided=1024 updated=4096
INFO [05-06|16:44:05.842] Maximum peer count                       ETH=50 LES=0 total=50
fatal error: unexpected signal during runtime execution
[signal SIGSEGV: segmentation violation code=0x1 addr=0x0 pc=0x7fff35ba9d64]

runtime stack:
runtime.throw(0x4dcac0d, 0x2a)
	/usr/local/Cellar/go/1.14.2_1/libexec/src/runtime/panic.go:1116 +0x72
runtime.sigpanic()
	/usr/local/Cellar/go/1.14.2_1/libexec/src/runtime/signal_unix.go:679 +0x46a
````

I installed ethereum through homebrew:
````
brew install ethereum
````

What macos version are you running on?

You can run with `--nousb` that should disable this part of the code, but it's a bit worrying that it crashed inside the usb library.

> What macos version are you running on?
> 
> You can run with `--nousb` that should disable this part of the code, but it's a bit worrying that it crashed inside the usb library.

The version is macOS Catalina 10.15.4. 

The error disappeared after I ran 'geth --nousb'. Things are going well by far.
i was having this error too, i user --nousb flag didn't worked for me. try to build with go version 1.16.6 it worked for me.
